docs.snippet: LONG BEACH, Cal., July 29. -- America's eight-oared racing crew will make its opening bid for a second successive Olympic championship against formidable opposition.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONG BEACH, Cal., July 29. -- America's eight-oared racing crew will make its opening bid for a second successive Olympic championship against formidable opposition.

headline.main: LANES ARE DRAWN IN COAST ROWING; United States Eight-Oared Crew Assigned to No. 1 Position in Second Heat Aug. 10. CANADIANS AMONG RIVALS New Zealand and Germany Also to Offer Opposition to American Olympic Oarsmen.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 29. -- Suggestions that Foreign Minister Zalles of Bolivia, through conferences with the Chilean Foreign Minister in Santiago, had obtained what amounted to Chilean acquiescence in a war between Bolivia and Paraguay over the Chaco...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 29. -- Suggestions that Foreign Minister Zalles of Bolivia, through conferences with the Chilean Foreign Minister in Santiago, had obtained what amounted to Chilean acquiescence in a war between Bolivia and Paraguay over the Chaco were discounted tonight by Miguel Cruchaga Tocornal, the Chilean Ambassador to the United States.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LOS ANGELES, July 30 -- Amid the roar of cannon, the crashing of bands and the liberation of thousands of pigeons which soared high above the lofty Stadium ramparts beneath a benign welkin, the tenth modern revival of the ancient Olympic Games was...
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES, July 30 -- Amid the roar of cannon, the crashing of bands and the liberation of thousands of pigeons which soared high above the lofty Stadium ramparts beneath a benign welkin, the tenth modern revival of the ancient Olympic Games was officially declared open today by Vice President Curtis in Exposition Park.

headline.main: CURTIS PROCLAIMS THE OLYMPICS OPEN AS 100,000 LOOK ON; Stirring Pageantry Marks the Inaugural Ceremonies of Tenth Modern Revival. 2,000 ATHLETES IN PARADE Representatives of 39 Nations March Proudly in Pictur- esque Costumes. OATH RITUAL IMPRESSIVE Lieutenant Calnan of Navy Leading Figure in the Climax Before Throng at Los Angeles. CURTIS PROCLAIMS THE OLYMPICS OPEN

byline.original: By ALLISON DANZIG.Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES.By ALLISON DANZIG

docs.snippet: Deputies denounce Bolivia and Paraguay for Chaco war threat
docs.abstract: Deputies denounce Bolivia and Paraguay for Chaco war threat

headline.main: CHACO WAR THREAT SCORED; Uruguayan Deputies Denounce Bolivia and Paraguay.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2. -- Bolivia was asked to agree to a suspension of hostilities with Paraguay in the Chaco on the basis of the status quo ante and to consent to submit the controversy to arbitration, in a note by the committee of neutral diplomats...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2. -- Bolivia was asked to agree to a suspension of hostilities with Paraguay in the Chaco on the basis of the status quo ante and to consent to submit the controversy to arbitration, in a note by the committee of neutral diplomats forwarded to Foreign Minister Gutierrez at La Paz tonight.
docs.abstract: Neutrals forward note to Bolivia for arbitration

headline.main: PRESSURE ON BOLIVIA APPLIED BY POWERS; American Neutrals Call on La Paz to Arbitrate Entire Dispute Over the Chaco. LEAGUE ASKS ACCEPTANCE Argentina, Chile and Peru Urge Refusal to Recognize Any Lands Won by War. BRAZIL HOLDS PLAN BACK Refuses to Sign Note on Grounds It Is Too Favorable to Paraguay -- Bolivia Indicates Firmness.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: ASUNCION, Aug. 2 (AP). -- President Jose P. Guggiari called upon the army to "achieve deeds of prowess" in a proclamation today called forth by the Chaco boundary conflict with Bolivia.
docs.lead_paragraph: ASUNCION, Aug. 2 (AP). -- President Jose P. Guggiari called upon the army to "achieve deeds of prowess" in a proclamation today called forth by the Chaco boundary conflict with Bolivia.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3. -- A new policy of peace for the Western Hemisphere was laid down in impressive circumstances today when the American nations joined in an identic note to Bolivia and Paraguay declaring that they would not recognize territorial...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3. -- A new policy of peace for the Western Hemisphere was laid down in impressive circumstances today when the American nations joined in an identic note to Bolivia and Paraguay declaring that they would not recognize territorial gains in the disputed Chaco region won by force of arms.
docs.abstract: 19 members send identic notes to Bolivia and Paraguay on Chaco dispute

headline.main: 19 AMERICAN NATIONS WARN ON CHACO WAR; Tell Paraguay and Bolivia Land Won by Force Will Not Be Recognized. QUICK PEACE IS FORECAST Principle Is Expected to Find a Wide Application -- New Clash Is Reported. NEW CODE INVOKED TO HALT CHACO WAR

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: 1,000 Children Ask Paraguay To Let Them Fight Bolivians
